column4: Hey you were just helping me with screensavers... I checked in /usr/share/applications/screensavers/ and there are a bunch of .desktop files that look like what I might be supposed to delete...
yeah, did you see my last to you? Pointed at that one ;)
I tried moving them to ../bak, logged out, and logged back in... they still show up in the screensaver list
Yep that's why I'm addressing you specifically this time around ;)
try removing all but 2, and setting random, see what happens
ok tried moving all into ../bak then moving three back into .
now screensaver will only display Xlyap
then you're on the right path
although all of them still show up in the list and the little mini-preview for all of them works
that's probably due to the xml files we looked at earlier
ok tried moving all the .xml files and replacing the ones that have .desktop files left in the apps dir
not sure then. It's an interesting exercise ;)
it could be you would need to restart gnome-session, or gnome-screensaver if it's running as a daemon
they have replacement keycaps you can buy ...
I wonder if any of them have the superman logo... ;)
